title: End of World War II
description: The war in Europe concludes with the surrender of Germany in May, followed by the surrender of Japan in September, ending the deadliest conflict in human history.

title: Invention of the Printing Press
description: Johannes Gutenberg introduces mechanical movable type printing to Europe, sparking the Printing Revolution.

title: First Successful Airplane Flight
description: The Wright brothers, Orville and Wilbur, achieve the first sustained, controlled, and powered heavier-than-air flight.

title: Discovery of Penicillin
description: Alexander Fleming discovers the antibiotic substance penicillin from the Penicillium notatum mould.

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
description: The Berlin Wall, a symbol of the Cold War, is opened, leading to the reunification of Germany.

title: Tiananmen Square Massacre
description: Chinese troops opened fire on peaceful student-led pro-democracy protests in Beijing, resulting in hundreds (possibly thousands) of deaths.

title: Temporal Contamination
description: You introduced a modern smartphone to 1955, causing a severe timeline disruption. The future is now uncertain.

title: Premature Enlightenment
description: You taught early humans how to create and control fire thousands of years ahead of schedule. Their societal development has become dangerously accelerated.

title: Da Vinci's Anomaly
description: You left a solar-powered calculator in Leonardo da Vinci's workshop. His inventions are now centuries ahead of their time, causing technological chaos.
